trans-unit.source: Represents a collection of <xref href="System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrust"></xref> objects.
This class cannot be inherited.
<xref:System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrust> objects encapsulate security decisions about an application.
Adds an element to the collection.
The <xref:System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrust> object is added to the end of the collection.
To remove an application trust that you previously added, use the <xref:System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrustCollection.Remove%2A> method.
The <xref href="System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrust"></xref> object to add.
The index at which the new element was inserted.
trust is `null`.
The property of the specified in trust is `null`.
Copies the elements of the specified <xref href="System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrust"></xref> array to the end of the collection.
The <xref:System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrust> objects contained in the `trusts` array are appended to the end of the collection.
To remove a range of application trusts that you previously added, use the <xref:System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrustCollection.RemoveRange%2A> method.
An array of type <xref href="System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrust"></xref> containing the objects to add to the collection.
trusts is `null`.
The property of an specified in trust is `null`.
Copies the elements of the specified <xref href="System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrustCollection"></xref> to the end of the collection.
The <xref:System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrust> objects contained in `trusts` are appended to the end of the collection.

You can use the <xref:System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrustCollection.AddRange%2A> method to quickly add another collection of application trust objects to the collection instead of manually adding each application trust to the collection using the <xref:System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrustCollection.Add%2A> method.
To remove a range of application trusts that you previously added, use the <xref:System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrustCollection.RemoveRange%2A> method.
A <xref href="System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrustCollection"></xref> containing the objects to add to the collection.
trusts is `null`.
The property of an specified in trust is `null`.
Removes all the application trusts from the collection.
Each <xref:System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrust> in the collection is identified by its <xref:System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrust.ApplicationIdentity%2A> property.

If the value of the <xref:System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrust.ApplicationIdentity%2A> property for any <xref:System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrust> object in the collection is `null`, an <xref:System.ArgumentException> is thrown.
The <xref href="System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrust.ApplicationIdentity"></xref> property of an item in the collection is `null`.
Copies the entire collection to a compatible one-dimensional array, starting at the specified index of the target array.
All the application trusts in the collection are copied into the array starting at the specified index location, overwriting any existing data within the range of objects copied into the array.
The one-dimensional array of type <xref href="System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrust"></xref> that is the destination of the elements copied from the current collection.
The zero-based index in array at which copying begins.
array is `null`.
index is less than the lower bound of array.
array is multidimensional.
-or-
The number of elements in the is greater than the available space from index to the end of the destination array.
Gets the number of items contained in the collection.
The number of items contained in the collection.
Gets the application trusts in the collection that match the specified application identity.
The application trust is optionally selected by an exact version match, based on the value of the `versionMatch` parameter.
An <xref href="System.ApplicationIdentity"></xref> object describing the application to find.
One of the <xref href="System.Security.Policy.ApplicationVersionMatch"></xref> values.
An <xref href="System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrustCollection"></xref> containing all matching <xref href="System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrust"></xref> objects.
Returns an object that can be used to iterate over the collection.
The <xref:System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrustEnumerator> implements the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator?displayProperty=fullName> interface that allows you to move within a collection.
Use the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.Current%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property to get the item currently pointed to in the collection.
Use the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.MoveNext%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to move to the next item in the collection.
Use the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.Reset%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to move the enumerator to its initial position.

After you create the enumerator, or use the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.Reset%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to reposition the enumerator to the start of the collection, you must then call the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.MoveNext%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to position the enumerator to the first item.
Otherwise, the item represented by the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.Current%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property is undefined.
An <xref href="System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrustEnumerator"></xref> that can be used to iterate over the collection.
Gets a value indicating whether access to the collection is synchronized (thread safe).
`false` in all cases.
Gets the <xref href="System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrust"></xref> object located at the specified index in the collection.
Use this method to get a <xref:System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrust> object from the <xref:System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrustCollection> at the specified index.
The zero-based index of the object within the collection.
The <xref href="System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrust"></xref> object at the specified index in the collection.
index is greater than or equal to the count of objects in the collection.
index is negative.
Gets the <xref href="System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrust"></xref> object for the specified application.

The <xref:System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrust.ApplicationIdentity%2A> property of each <xref:System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrust> object in the collection is examined for a <xref:System.ApplicationIdentity.FullName%2A> property value that matches the application specified by the `appFullName` parameter.
The full name of the application.
The <xref href="System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrust"></xref> object for the specified application, or `null` if the object cannot be found.
Removes the specified application trust from the collection.
The entire collection is searched, and all instances of the specified application trust are removed.
The objects that follow the removed objects move up to occupy the vacated positions.
The indexes of the objects that are moved are also updated.
The <xref href="System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrust"></xref> object to remove.
trust is `null`.
The property of the object specified by trust is `null`.
Removes all application trust objects that match the specified criteria from the collection.
The application trust can be identified by an exact version match, dependent upon the value of the `versionMatch` parameter.
The <xref:System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrustCollection.Find%2A> method is used to locate all matching application trusts, and the matching items are removed from the collection.
The objects that follow the removed objects move up to occupy the vacated positions.
The indexes of the objects that are moved are also updated.
The <xref href="System.ApplicationIdentity"></xref> of the <xref href="System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrust"></xref> object to be removed.
One of the <xref href="System.Security.Policy.ApplicationVersionMatch"></xref> values.
Removes the application trust objects in the specified array from the collection.
The objects that follow the removed objects move up to occupy the vacated positions.
The indexes of the objects that are moved are also updated.
A one-dimensional array of type <xref href="System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrust"></xref> that contains items to be removed from the current collection.
trusts is `null`.
Removes the application trust objects in the specified collection from the collection.
The objects that follow the removed objects move up to occupy the vacated positions.
The indexes of the objects that are moved are also updated.
An <xref href="System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrustCollection"></xref> that contains items to be removed from the currentcollection.
trusts is `null`.
Gets an object that can be used to synchronize access to the collection.
The default implementation returns the current application trust object.
The object to use to synchronize access to the collection.
Copies the elements of the <xref href="System.Collections.ICollection"></xref> to the specified <xref href="System.Array"></xref>, starting at the specified <xref href="System.Array"></xref> index.
The one-dimensional <xref href="System.Array"></xref> that is the destination of the elements copied from the <xref href="System.Collections.ICollection"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Array"></xref> must have zero-based indexing.
The zero-based index in array at which copying begins.
array is `null`.
index is less than zero.
array is multidimensional.
-or-
The number of elements in the source is greater than the available space from index to the end of the destination array.
Returns an enumerator that iterates through the collection.
An <xref href="System.Collections.IEnumerator"></xref> that can be used to iterate through the collection.
